snippet: In Slovyansk, a city of 80,000 that was a stronghold for pro-Russian rebels, Ukraine authorities have a difficult task ahead to shift the loyalties of residents to keep the peace.
abstract: Slovyansk, Ukraine, now back under government's control, is seen as test of whether Ukrainian authorities can gain back loyalties of its rebellious residents in order to keep peace; government has set up hotline for residents to inform on rebel collaborators, and are flooding city with troops and free food.
lead_paragraph: In Slovyansk, a city of 80,000 that was a stronghold for pro-Russian rebels, Ukraine authorities have a difficult task ahead to shift the loyalties of residents to keep the peace.

headline.main: A Test for Ukraine in a City Retaken From Rebels
headline.print_headline: A Test for Ukraine in a City Retaken From Rebels
